metadata.title: CVE-2016-6516 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Race condition in the ioctl_file_dedupe_range function in fs/ioctl.c in theLinux kernel through 4.7 allows local users to cause a denial of service(heap-based buffer overflow) or possibly gain privileges by changing acertain count value, aka a "double fetch" vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6516` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.8.0-36-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-36-generic-lpae - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-36-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.8.0-36-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
